originalText.text:
Steroid factory assembly line clinic only here to filled their pockets, milking from mostly Medicare patients. Stay away from dodgy two faced Doc Patel. Don’t believe the hype and her high profile appearance because she won’t listen to your real causes for pain, dismissed your pertinent past medical procedures, test results, scan history, and medical records. Her staff will also lie about giving you numbness meds before steroid injection procedure is beyond immoral and unethical.
Clinic is a shamble not for pain management at all.

originalText.text: I had a very good experience at the office today. The young woman who was in the OR while Dr.J was doing my spinal injection was exceptional. She was very caring and attentive of my needs and made sure that I was comfortable during the procedure.  All of the staff in that area of the office was totally on point today and I really appreciate the help and care that I received today. I must also say that Dr. J is one of the best Medical providers that I have ever had, he is very clear about all matters related to my medical situation and takes the time to insure that I understand all aspects of my care.

originalText.text:
You people are a joke. Do not call me and delete my information in your system. What is the point of having a scheduled appointment if you don't see your patients in a timely manner and not updating them as to why is taking a long time in calling them is common courtesy especially if they've been fasting since the night before. My appointment 11:30am I arrived 10:30am another patient arrived after me approximately 10:40am had appointment with the same Dr I was scheduled with to have my procedure Dr yang . That patient was late to his appointment as that is what he stated when he arrived. They called me to urinate in a cup and change clothes at 11:58am to have me wait some more in a little room cold and hungry I waited until 12:30pm and left without saying a word then they call my phone left a voicemail because I'm not picking up saying they were about to call me or if I want to reschedule . Lose my number!! You ain't hearing from me.

Fast forward to August 11th I received a bill of $25 for no show !!!! Ha ! you not getting a penny out of me!!! I will hire a lawyer!!

originalText.text:
Dr. Alexis is very nice and compassionate. I've been to the Manhattan office and Staten island office. I prefer the Manhattan office. Everyone is nice and friendly there. The Staten island office (Victory Blvd) was not as friendly at least the front desk and the appointment person. However the staff for procedures were nice. I've been seeing Dr. Alexis for a few months and he has been very attentive and understand. He discusses procedure carefully and asks for my opinion. I recently was introduced to Dr. Chapman and he was attentive and informative as well. I would recommend both Dr. Alexis and Dr. Chapman. However locations I would stick to the Manhattan unless absolutely necessary to travel to Staten island (Victory Blvd). Can't say anything of the other locations though.

1/6/18. Better visit than the one I experienced on 11/11/17. I did spend about 2 hours at the office but I wasn't waiting for all of the 2 hrs. I was in and out in two hours. Let's hope the procedure helps.

originalText.text:
My experience at Dr. Chapman's office has always been a pleasure. The atmosphere is totally professional and his staff exhibits a genuine caring attitude unsurpassed by any other doctors office I've ever encountered.  It takes a deep trust to allow someone to stick a needle into your spine and Dr. Chapman has earned that trust repeatedly.  As far as the unflattering reviews I have read, I am completely shocked that any patients would have a complaint. Dr
Chapman , in my experience, has always taken time to speak and address any concerns I may have no matter how big or small. Furthermore, Dr. Chapman doesn't speak down to you as some other physicians have a habit of doing. I was there today, every staff member, every nurse greeted me with a smile, asked if I was comfortable and kept me in the loop every step of the way
To Dr. Chapman and all of you wonderful RNs don't ever change. You're great the way you are. To the PA's and ladies who make my appointments and answer my emails in a flash I want to give you a shout out too, you're the best and my family and I feel you're worth your weight in gold. So, to all out there if I could give one piece of advise it would be  to put your faith in Dr. Chapman's hands.
